gui

Class AttackClickHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.AttackClickHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>

    public class AttackClickHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>
    The event handler for the board in the display where players click where they want to attack. it deals with taking the player's input, managing and updating the boards of all players, displaying the next player's turn and checking for win condition.

    The event handler ends by calling AttackPhase where the attack phase of the next player is displayed and the board is ready to receive input from the player which in turn calls this event handler again. This loop ends when the win condition is met. By then. It calls another AttackPhase display where the event listener for the board is disabled which ends the game and stops the loop.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane aiTurnTransition()
      Transition in P-v-AI mode to let the player know that the AI is making a move initiates playerTurn for AI which makes the attack for the AI and updates the boards.
      void handle(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent myEvent)
      Finds Column and row clicked, checks if it was previously hit ) Sends Attack which updates the player's guessBoard and enemy gameBoard Checks for win condition then displays transition modes.
      javafx.scene.layout.VBox pvpTurnTransition()
      Transition in PvP mode to hide previous player's display since both players shouldn't see the other player's boards.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttackClickHandler

        public AttackClickHandler(double BlockSize,
                          javafx.scene.Scene scn,
                          java.lang.String attackingPlayer)
        The constructor for this event handler. It sets up which player is attacking and which player is attacked so that it can modify the boards of the corresponding player.
        Parameters:
        scn - - the Scene where the root will be changed to display the next player's attack phase
        BlockSize - - a double type value of the size of a single square in the current grid
        attackingPlayer - - a String that indicates which player attacked and initiated this event handler

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent myEvent)
        Finds Column and row clicked, checks if it was previously hit ) Sends Attack which updates the player's guessBoard and enemy gameBoard Checks for win condition then displays transition modes.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>

      • pvpTurnTransition

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox pvpTurnTransition()
        Transition in PvP mode to hide previous player's display since both players shouldn't see the other player's boards.
        Returns:
        a new root for the scene to transition into for the pause for each turn. (with a button)

      • aiTurnTransition

        public javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane aiTurnTransition()
        Transition in P-v-AI mode to let the player know that the AI is making a move initiates playerTurn for AI which makes the attack for the AI and updates the boards. After a few seconds, the display returns to the Human player's attack phase with the updated boards.
        Returns:
        a new root for the scene to transition into for the pause for each turn
